subject: Re: Min-box vs. RS hack
author: rosemary_guiley
full_text:
Hi Sam,

I bought a Mini-Box -- the first one off the production line, in fact
-- and yes, it is a lot clearer than either of my two Frank's Boxes,
which I pointed out on the air on C2C.  I also have the RS Hack, and
it works quite well, and certainly provides an economical alternative
to people.

For the record, I have no vested interest in Mini-boxes, the hacks or
any ITC devices.  I have stated opinions about the Mini and it's
advantages, and it's OK to have those used as testimonials. I am using
a variety of devices in my work, and they are all valuable to me.  I
travel a lot, so the Mini and the RSH will be the devices of choice,
especially since they are more portable and less fragile than the FBs. 

Regards
Rosemary

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "sam_stout" <sam_stout@...> wrote:
>
> I'm new to this group, but not to ITC research. I'm familiar with
> spirit communications using boxes like Frank's, the mini-box, and RS
> hack. I've seen the picture of Frank with the mini-box. Frank, it
> looks to me that you are promoting this mini-box. Is that correct? If
> so, is it the only box that you are promoting now? Or are they just
> using your image and a few of your statements to push their box? What
> I heard of the C2C show it seemed to me that it was more of a
> promotion for the mini-box. They posted something about that their box
> has a cleaner signal and Frank's box had more noise to it. Well,
> sometimes in this line of work you want to have a little bit of
> inherent noise. I know that the RS radio has to meet FCC Class B
> regulations Part 15. As for being a cleaner signal, I would think that
> the RS radio would actually be, than the mini-box. I have heard both
> the mini-box and the RS hack and I can't tell a lot of differences
> between the two except for the price. It's my understanding that the
> mini-box is selling around $400 and that's a lot of money for just a
> AM radio. The RS radio is selling for $24.95 and I know people are
> getting some great results with the RS hack. Just my two cents worth!!
> 
> Sam
>
